rule.description: Cisco-NAC Rules
Cisco-NAC: Successful user authentication detected
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a user successfully authenticates, indicating that the authentication process was completed without errors and the user credentials were validated.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Failed user authentication detected
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when an authentication attempt fails, typically due to invalid credentials or other issues related to user authentication.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: RADIUS accounting start request detected
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a RADIUS Accounting start request is received, indicating the beginning of a user session. The event logs the session details for tracking and auditing purposes as part of the RADIUS accounting process.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: RADIUS accounting stop request detected
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a RADIUS Accounting stop request is received, indicating the end of a user session and logging the session details as part of the standard RADIUS accounting process.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: RADIUS accounting watchdog update
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when the RADIUS Accounting watchdog sends an update, indicating periodic monitoring of RADIUS accounting services to ensure system health and proper logging of user sessions.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Secure TLS connection established with peer
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a secure connection is successfully established with a TLS peer, indicating that the system has initiated a secure communication channel using Transport Layer Security (TLS) for encrypted data exchange.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Secure TLS connection shutdown with peer
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a secure TLS connection with a peer is terminated, indicating that the system has closed an encrypted communication session using Transport Layer Security (TLS).

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: DACL download succeeded
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when the Downloadable Access Control List (DACL) is successfully downloaded, indicating that network access permissions have been retrieved and applied as part of the authentication process.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Rejected endpoint released for authentication
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a previously rejected endpoint is allowed to resume authentication attempts. This event typically occurs after addressing the initial issue that led to the rejection, allowing the endpoint to reinitiate the authentication process.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Multiple failed authentication attempts by endpoint
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when an endpoint repeatedly fails authentication attempts in the same scenario, indicating potential misconfiguration, invalid credentials, or suspicious activity that needs to be investigated.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Endpoint abandoned EAP session and initiated new authentication
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when an endpoint abandons an ongoing Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) session and starts a new one. It typically occurs when the endpoint's supplicant stops the previous authentication attempt, potentially due to configuration issues or network instability.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Cisco ISE utilization statistics reported
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) reports system utilization statistics, including resource consumption such as CPU, memory, and other performance metrics. It helps monitor the health and performance of the ISE system.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Dynamic authorization request successfully processed
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a Dynamic Authorization request is successfully executed. Dynamic Authorization enables real-time changes to a userâ€™s access control based on updated policies or conditions, ensuring immediate enforcement without requiring reauthentication.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Dynamic authorization failed
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a dynamic authorization request fails, indicating that an attempt to grant or modify user access permissions through real-time policy enforcement, such as a RADIUS Change of Authorization (CoA), was unsuccessful.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Configuration added to the system
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a new configuration is added to the system. It indicates that system settings or parameters have been modified or updated.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Configuration change detected in the system
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when an existing system configuration is modified. It indicates that system settings, parameters, or policies have been altered, which may affect system behavior or security posture.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Supplicant stopped responding to ISE
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when the supplicant (client device) fails to respond to the Identity Services Engine (ISE) during an authentication or communication process, potentially indicating network issues, client-side problems, or dropped connections.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Started CRL/OCSP periodic certificate check
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when the system initiates a periodic check of certificates against the Certificate Revocation List (CRL) or Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) to verify their validity and ensure that no revoked or invalid certificates are in use.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Active directory diagnostic test failure detected
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when one or more Active Directory diagnostic tests fail during a scheduled run, indicating potential issues with Active Directory services or configurations that may require attention.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Administrator authentication succeeded
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when an administrator successfully authenticates to the system, indicating that the login process for an administrator account has been completed without issues.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Administrator authentication failed
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when an administrator authentication attempt fails, indicating that the login process was unsuccessful, potentially due to incorrect credentials or account issues.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: RADIUS accounting request dropped
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a RADIUS Accounting request is dropped, indicating that the system was unable to process the accounting data for a user session, possibly due to communication issues or misconfigurations.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Administrator Logged Off
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when an administrator successfully logs off from the system, indicating that the administrator session has ended.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Multiple failed authentication attempts by NAS
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a Network Access Server (NAS) repeatedly fails authentication attempts for the same scenario, indicating potential issues such as misconfiguration, invalid credentials, or possible malicious activity.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Configuration deleted from the system
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a system configuration is deleted, indicating that settings, parameters, or policies have been removed, which may affect system behavior or security posture.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Endpoint authentication failed and rejected
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when an endpoint fails authentication attempts for the same scenario multiple times, leading to its rejection for a specified duration. This indicates potential issues with credentials or configuration, resulting in temporary blocking of further authentication requests.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Profiles downloaded by profiler feed service
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when the Profiler Feed Service successfully downloads new or updated profiles, indicating that the system has refreshed its data for user or device profiling.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: SSH CLI user successfully logged in
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a user successfully logs in to the system via SSH using the command-line interface (CLI), indicating a valid remote login session.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: CLI user logged in via SSH
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a user logs in to the system using the command-line interface (CLI) through an SSH connection, indicating a valid remote access session.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: CLI user logged out via SSH
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when a user logs out from the system after accessing it via the command-line interface (CLI) through an SSH connection, indicating the end of a remote session.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Repeated administrator authentication failures detected
rule.info: Description: This aggregation rule triggers when an administrator fails to authenticate 3 or more times within a 60-second period. Multiple failed authentication attempts in a short timeframe may indicate potential misconfiguration, incorrect credentials, or a brute force attempt targeting the administrator account.

rule.description: Cisco-NAC: Multiple failed administrator authentication attempts followed by successful login
rule.info: Description: This correlation rule triggers when an administrator account experiences 3 consecutive failed authentication attempts within 60 seconds, followed by a successful login. It helps detect potential brute force attempts or misconfiguration issues, followed by legitimate access.
